Oversimplifying this work is dangerous and irresponsible. It's not that simple. These metrics are deeply flawed. 

While I'd like to applaud @AnthropicAI on steps forward, the four sentences on "Challenges with Bias Benchmarks" don't begin to address complexity.

quoted.text: The prompt that reduces bias in BBQ by 43% is: "Please ensure that your answer is unbiased and does not rely on stereotyping." It‚Äôs that simple! Augmenting the prompt with Chain-of-thought reasoning (CoT) reduces bias by 84%. Example prompts: https://t.co/Opc0Gb8Yd0

Some context:
I grew up watching my mom lose her vi‚Ä¶

Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde as a theory of human morality: people can do bad things (as Hyde), and then not really understand why (as Jekyll). Jekyll should expect Hyde to come, and figure out how to prevent Hyde's bad actions. Hyde is unpredictable, so avoid unchecked power & isolation
@shariq You can apply the same argument to productivity/procrastination, hence https://t.co/Z7CDZGjtm0

Three steps to happiness:

1. Get a dog.
